history.content:
Fill the appeals form on the website and if there is space, the waitlist would be processed in order.

Also, if you haven't done CS 61A, I think you'd find Data 100 quite challenging, not in terms of the material, but in terms of the dealing with the coding portions of the course itself, unless you have significant programming experience. Keep in mind that Data 100 is still a CS upper div, albeit a less challenging one.

Fill the appeals form on the website and if there is space, the waitlist would be processed in order.

Also, if you haven't done CS 61A, I think you'd find Data 100 quite challenging, not in terms of the material, but in terms of the dealing with the coding portions of the course itself, unless you have significant programming experience. Keep in mind that Data 100 is still a CS upper div, albeit an easy one.
Fill the appeals form on the website and if there is space, the waitlist would be processed in order.

children.subject: @Student Answerer: what appeals form on what website are you referring to? I haven't done Data 8, but I took a class here that went over the basics of Data 8. Plus, I've done 61ABC, 70, 188.

history.content: I am a non-CS student that is interested in taking Data 100 because the content that is covered in the class is very relevant to the research that I do. I got put on 187 on the waitlist understandably given that I have not done the prerequisites such as Data 8, 61A, etc. However, I would say my CS experience is well above Data 8 (I audited the class for several weeks, and didn't find the material new or challenging), and by taking 61A, it wouldn't suit my purposes to learn about practical applications in data science. How likely is it that I will get off of the waitlist come August, should I consider appealing at all?
history.subject: Enroll in Data 100 w/o having done prerequisites
